title: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Les Poissons [Pisces], from Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service", 1824
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, pink/tan watercolor, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, ruled border in pen and brown ink
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown/black ink over graphite, on support, above image:  Les Poissons; below image:  ça n'mord pas [The fish are not biting]; in graphite, upper right corner of mount:  2
description: Scene at a river bank.  A man, center foreground, is seated at the river's edge holidng a fishing line in his left hand, while scratching his head with his right hand, apparently wondering why he is not catching any fish.  A hat, bucket, and a plate of bait [worms] are on the ground to his left.  A man and woman, center middleground, standing against a background of trees, admire a catch of three small fish.  A fishermaan in a small boat appears in the left rearground.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Les Poissons [Pisces], from Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service", 1824. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, pink/tan watercolor, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, ruled border in pen and brown ink. 1989-13-36.
